Yokogawa instrument drivers¶

class pyslave.drivers.yokogawa.yokogawa7651.yokogawa7651(resource, *args, **kwargs)¶

Yokogawa 7651 instrument driver. Direct call to the instrument invokes the ramp method.

trigger()¶

Triggering function for the Yokogawa 7651.

After changing any parameters of the instrument (for example, output voltage), the device needs to be triggered before it will update.

setVoltageRange(value)¶

Function changes the voltage range of the power supply. A float representing the desired voltage will have the range adjusted accordingly, or a string specifying the range will also work.

Parameters:value – Desired voltage or directly specified voltage range as a string (10mV, 100mV, 1V, 10V, 30V)
setCurrentRange(value)¶

Function changes the current range of the power supply. A float representing the desired current will have the range adjusted accordingly, or a string specifying the range will also work.

Parameters:value – Desired current or directly specified current range as a string (1mA, 10mA, 100mA)
setFunction(func)¶

Set the output of the Yokogawa 7651 to either constant voltage or constant current mode.

Parameters:func – Desired mode as a string (‘voltage’ or ‘current’)
setValue(value, autorange=True)¶

Set the output value of the power supply.

Parameters:
  • value – Desired constant output value in V or A
  • autorange – If True, the instrument will automatically adapt its range to the value
setOutput(setting)¶

Enable or disable the output of the Yokogawa 7651.

Parameters:setting – Specify the state of the power supply output (True or False).
ramp(value, slope=0.1)¶

Ramp the output value of the power supply at the given slope.

Parameters:
  • value – Desired final output value in V or A
  • slope – Desired slope in V/s or A/s
ready()¶

Blocks until the output is stabilized.
